name: ApexSqlDotCompare
description: Allows to make a full comparison of the states of databases.
author: ApexSQL LLC

inputs.name: sourceFromDatabase
inputs.label: From database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option, if source is database

inputs.name: connSource
inputs.label: Database folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether database source project is located in repository root or subfolder path

inputs.name: connSourceSubDir
inputs.label: Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter full path to database source project

inputs.name: sourceSqlServer
inputs.label: Source SQL Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify source database server. E.g. SERVERNAME\INSTANCENAME. For local default instance leave as '(local)''

inputs.name: sourceSqlLogin
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify login name to use for SQL Server authentication. Leave empty for Windows authentication

inputs.name: sourceSqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify password to use for SQL Server authentication. Leave empty for Windows authentication

inputs.name: targetFromDatabase
inputs.label: From database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose this option, if target is database

inputs.name: connTarget
inputs.label: Database folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether database target project is located in repository root or subfolder path

inputs.name: connTargetSubDir
inputs.label: Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter full path to database target project

inputs.name: targetSqlServer
inputs.label: Target SQL Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify target database server. E.g. SERVERNAME\INSTANCENAME. For local default instance leave as '(local)'

inputs.name: targetSqlLogin
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify login name to use for SQL Server authentication. Leave empty for Windows authentication

inputs.name: targetSqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify password to use for SQL Server authentication. Leave empty for Windows authentication
